articles.headline: Silicon Valley Investors’ Plans for a New City Put on Hold
articles.snippet: The East Solano Plan, a proposal for a walkable urban community in a rural corner of the San Francisco Bay Area, stoked tension, fear and mistrust among some neighbors.
articles.abstract: The East Solano Plan, a proposal for a walkable urban community in a rural corner of the San Francisco Bay Area, stoked tension, fear and mistrust among some neighbors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley’s plans for a start-up city are on hold.

articles.headline: Female Donors Mobilize for Harris, Moving to Stamp Out Opposition
articles.snippet: Vice President Kamala Harris has an orbit of Bay Area billionaires and loyalists, all women, who can power her bid for the Democratic nomination. But some big donors are still seeking other options.
articles.abstract: Vice President Kamala Harris has an orbit of Bay Area billionaires and loyalists, all women, who can power her bid for the Democratic nomination. But some big donors are still seeking other options.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, Kamala Harris has been bolstered by a tight-knit group of female donors who rose up with her in Democratic politics. And for weeks, even when she was still insisting that President Biden would be the party’s nominee, these allies began to make moves to make sure her historic campaign would not be built on the fly.

articles.headline: Harris Steps Into the Spotlight, Reintroducing Herself on Her Own Terms
articles.snippet: Vice President Kamala Harris scooped up endorsements and wasted no time starting to build her new profile as the presumptive nominee and the new hope for defeating former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: Vice President Kamala Harris scooped up endorsements and wasted no time starting to build her new profile as the presumptive nominee and the new hope for defeating former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vice President Kamala Harris drew on her past as a prosecutor on Monday in her first campaign appearance since President Biden dropped his re-election bid, saying her law enforcement background would help her defeat a rival who is a convicted criminal.
articles.byline: By Erica L. Green and Zolan Kanno-Youngs

articles.headline: A Lot Has Changed for Women Since 2016. What Does That Mean for Kamala Harris?
articles.snippet: Voters eager to elect the first female president pointed to anger over a loss of abortion rights, but also acknowledged a fear that sexism would remain difficult for Ms. Harris to overcome.
articles.abstract: Voters eager to elect the first female president pointed to anger over a loss of abortion rights, but also acknowledged a fear that sexism would remain difficult for Ms. Harris to overcome.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the eight years since Hillary Clinton failed to win the American presidency, the work force for the first time grew to include more college-educated women than college-educated men. The #MeToo movement exposed sexual harassment and toppled powerful men. The Supreme Court overturned the federal right to abortion.
articles.byline: By Patricia Mazzei, Jenna Russell, Richard Fausset and Christina Morales

articles.headline: An Olympian’s Awkward Packing List: Toothbrush? Check. Rifle? Check.
articles.snippet: For members of the U.S. shooting team, competitions may be the easy part. Just getting to them takes steely nerves and careful planning.
articles.abstract: For members of the U.S. shooting team, competitions may be the easy part. Just getting to them takes steely nerves and careful planning.
articles.lead_paragraph: Olympic shooters have time-tested mental exercises they use to get through some of the most stressful moments of their careers: They exhale deeply to steady their nerves. They assess the targets ahead of them. They trust in the preparation that got them there.

articles.headline: A.I. Can Write Poetry, but It Struggles With Math
articles.snippet: A.I.’s math problem reflects how much the new technology is a break with computing’s past.
articles.abstract: A.I.’s math problem reflects how much the new technology is a break with computing’s past.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the school year that ended recently, one class of learners stood out as a seeming puzzle. They are hard-working, improving and remarkably articulate. But curiously, these learners — artificially intelligent chatbots — often struggle with math.

articles.headline: Can Kamala Harris Sell ‘Bidenomics’?
articles.snippet: Much of President Biden’s agenda polls well, but voters roundly dislike his handling of the economy. That’s a campaign challenge for his vice president, as she mounts a presidential bid.
articles.abstract: Much of President Biden’s agenda polls well, but voters roundly dislike his handling of the economy. That’s a campaign challenge for his vice president, as she mounts a presidential bid.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kamala Harris hits the campaign trail after President Biden exits. Follow live updates.

articles.headline: Trump’s New Rival May Bring Out His Harshest Instincts
articles.snippet: After years planning to face President Biden, Donald J. Trump and his team will be campaigning against Kamala Harris. He has attacked female rivals and critics in brutal and personal terms.
articles.abstract: After years planning to face President Biden, Donald J. Trump and his team will be campaigning against Kamala Harris. He has attacked female rivals and critics in brutal and personal terms.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest news about the 2024 election, and the Trump and Harris campaigns.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Swan

articles.headline: Secret Service Director Resigns After Trump Assassination Attempt
articles.snippet: Kimberly A. Cheatle gave up her post Tuesday after security failures that allowed a gunman to shoot at former President Donald J. Trump at an open-air rally.
articles.abstract: Kimberly A. Cheatle gave up her post Tuesday after security failures that allowed a gunman to shoot at former President Donald J. Trump at an open-air rally.
articles.lead_paragraph: The director of the Secret Service, Kimberly A. Cheatle, resigned on Tuesday, after security failures surrounding the attempted assassination of former President Donald J. Trump and calls for her to step down from lawmakers in both parties.
articles.byline: By Hamed Aleaziz, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Kate Kelly

articles.headline: Why Katharine Graham’s Washington Home Has Sat Vacant for 22 Years
articles.snippet: The home of the former Washington Post publisher was once a hub of power and comity. But after an “insane” renovation spat, its new owner is looking to sell.
articles.abstract: The home of the former Washington Post publisher was once a hub of power and comity. But after an “insane” renovation spat, its new owner is looking to sell.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect John F. Kennedy was there for dinner the night before his inauguration. Years later, President-elect Ronald Reagan was there too. So were Truman Capote, Princess Diana, Supreme Court justices, cabinet members, diplomats, financiers and thousands more who came to a hub of bipartisan Washington power where guests dined, debated and often parted as friends.
